I tried adjusting the colors but the reddish/pinkish hue was still discrete I left. I had high hopes for this monitor, being an HP product and all, and really wanted to like it. Although the other monitor was ok, I’ve decided to return both (after reading the other reviews posted after I bought these) since I don’t want to wait for the other monitor to show signs of discoloration just after return period expires on January 31, 2021. No wonder the price was relatively cheap. I hope you will not have the same experience that I’ve had. I will update this review once I turn them both on when I return to work on Monday and show a picture of what I’m talking about.Update: 1/4/21: uploaded a picture of the reddish/pinkish hue on the screen on the left

title: Unreliable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 28, 2020
text: I was excited to get two HP 24mh monitors for my home office. The size and resolution were a good match for my Surface Book. The thin margin on 3 sides makes working across multiple monitors much easier. Unfortunately, neither monitor worked correctly out of the box. One constantly turned itself on and off and the sound wouldn't work on either of them (second monitor started the on/off thing after the third day). HP support was not a good experience. They blamed the PC and Microsoft blamed the monitor. I had to spend several hours with my own IT company trouble-shooting to verify that the problem was with the monitors. HP's virtual assistant does not seem to understand that HP sells monitors apart from computers. HP's technical assistance chat person quickly told me that I had to call a different technical support line for this problem and that there would be a nominal fee for the service. (What!?). I called anyway but got bored waiting and explored Amazon's support (Tokyo rocks!) Return and refund were processed right away and I ordered Dell monitors instead.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Buyer Beware
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 25, 2022
text: This didn't even last 3 months. It worked fine, until today, when it didn't. Yesterday it was working fine. Today I turned it on, and first there was one horizontal, purple "band" going across the screen. Within minutes, there were several purple, green, and dotted lines going horizontally on the screen, and three lines going vertically down the screen, along with an odd shaped splotch of purple and black. There are no cracks, it wasn't dropped, product was handled with the utmost care. Whenever I'd use it, I would carefully return it to the manufacturer's box, with the styrofoam included, to keep it protected. Called Amazon, who transferred me to HP tech support. Now they say they're going to send me a box and shipping label. If the problem is internal and because of faulty hardware, they are supposed to send me a new monitor. If it is because of "damage," then they'll "contact me." I'm not holding my breath that this will work out smoothly. At almost $200, I expect a product to work longer than 3 months. With runaway inflation, I don't have the resources or patience to keep replacing practically brand new monitors.

title: Poor quality; poor support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021
text: Picture quality was average while it worked.  However, the display developed a line of dead pixels after about 10 months of use.  HP warranty support has been poor.  After much effort trying to connect with warranty support, I was able to create a return ticket.  It took about two weeks for them to provide the return packaging.  The monitor was returned with a delivery indication about two weeks ago, but the return status indicates they are still waiting for delivery of the monitor.  I simply don't have time to babysit this return so I will be purchasing a non-HP replacement monitor.  No, I do not recommend this monitor.  No, I do not recommend HP.  The display quality was average at best; build quality was poor; warranty support is poor.UPDATE: I just spent over 60 minutes on the phone with with HP being transferred across five agents all saying, "It's not my area."  One of them confirmed they received the return but couldn't tell me why the display hadn't been returned or replaced, and then gave me yet another number to call.  My last transfer ended with a dead line so I gave up.  I will never again purchase an HP product.

title: HP Customer Support is atrocious
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 2, 2021
text: I liked this monitor and thought it was decent for the price until the a black line appeared down the middle of the monitor on the 31st day.  I know even quality new products fail occasionally so no big deal I just need to contact HP to get it repaired/replaced as it is still under warranty.That is where the problem began.  They quickly agreed it was defective and agreed to replace it.  They said they would send me packaging and a return label and once they received it they would send out a replacement.  I asked if they could send out a replacement immediately if I put a credit card on file so I would not have to be without a monitor for an extended period and they said they could not do that.  OK. I will just have to live without for the 8-10 days they quoted.It has now been 13 days since they started the return process and it is still showing a status of "Preparing shipping materials"  I contacted HP support after 10 days and they said they would send a note to the team responsible to get it moving along and they would keep me updated on progress.  I still have not received any additional information and it is still in the same state.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS MONITOR/DISPLAY!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 18, 2021
text: This monitor is wonderful... UNTIL it suddenly stops working for NO reason!!! You will suddenly get this error message: "Input Signal Not Found, Check the video cable and video source, Display going to sleep". You check all of the cables, unplug & replug them, and it still won't come back on. The only way to fix it is to shut off the computer and reboot it! After going through this problem every day for a couple of weeks, multiple times a day, my computer has started to have great difficulty rebooting. I believe it's being damaged by all the hard reboots. And HP's website says there are only two possible solutions to this problem: Change sleep/hibernate settings to "never", and if that doesn't work (which it didn't in my case!), HP says just don't use the software (or app) that causes the error message! Problem is, it's now happened in eight different programs/apps... way too many to simply stop using them all!!! This monitor is simply garbage!!! Of course, this didn't start happening until after the return window expired, so I lost a sizable chunk of money and will now have to find and buy a different brand monitor! :(((

text: I'm using this with my MacBook pro since that screen is too small for long work sessions. When the HP monitor wakes from auto-sleep mode, the on screen mouse pointer does not appear on the HP screen. Amazon and HP support could not help me with this, so amazon offered for me to return the HP monitor and replace it. The replacement monitor has the same issue and is even more erratic with the on screen mouse pointer. And, this monitor is 1/4 the price of the least expensive apple recommended monitor. For that reason, I'll make this work for now. The lesson I've learned - if you do a lot of number/spreadsheet/text editing work and don't need frequent mobility for those applications, stick with a desktop machine and use an ipad/tablet for portability.

title: Moderate Picture Quality, Misleading Audio Options
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021
text: I'm not sure if I got a lemon, or if I'm just the victim of some poor or misleading advertising. The only way I can get audio to the speakers is via HDMI. Except there's no volume controls on the monitor, and most systems (including macs, gaming consoles, etc) don't allow you to adjust volume before outputting, so there's no way to adjust system volume using HDMI for audio.It came with a male-to-male 3.5mm audio cable, the type you'd expect to use to connect speakers to your computer. But in plugging the cable into the monitor and the computer, I don't get any sound. The only way I've found to get sound is to switch the audio output on my computer back from headphones to hdmi. So I don't know if the audio jack is a broken input, or if it's actually an output that allows your audio from the hdmi to go to external speakers. The fact that the audio port is completely unmarked doesn't help, either.As for the display itself, it's OK I guess. The quality isn't as good as the iMac that it replaced, despite the fact that my iMac was over 8 years old. The brightness and colors are passable, but it seems noticeably less sharp, even though this monitor and my old iMac both have a resolution of 1080p.

title: Monitor stopped working within 6 weeks. HP refuses to honor warranty
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 2, 2021
text: I'm sure modern monitors break randomly from time to time. Mine did that - one day I turned it on to find a black splotch and lines across the top. No big deal. It took several hours to get HP to connect me to the warranty people, which was very frustrating, but seems to be normal now days.HP said they would expedite a box for me to mail in the broken monitor, they would replace it. That was 3 weeks ago. No box has arrived.Last week I gave up and bought a new monitor. Now I'll try to get HP to refund me.So on the one hand, the monitor is probably fine - I am sure a small percentage of every brand monitor randomly breaks. But the time it took to get actual help from HP - navigating their very awkward phone system and chat system and then pushing them to do the right thing, and then them ignoring me. Not cool.I don't like it when people say blanket statements like, 'NEVER buy from (insert company) again.' But I'll steer clear of HP purely based on their extremely poor and neglectful customer service and their inability to honor their warranty.

title: Value 24" monitor, pathetic support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020
text: July 2021 update - Monitor developed a few black spots in March (6 months of use) as my kid used it extensively for her online classes. Nightmare with HP support started in late May, when I first reported the issue. Poor communication from HP led me to understand they will first ship the replacement and then I can ship the problematic monitor. A month of calls later HP has my monitor, repairs it and sends it to a wrong address. Now it can't speak internally to the service center to provide me updates. I call or chat with the offshore team, who say they are escalating but no resolution. So frustrated at the really horrible support. Support site says monitor exchanged and gives me no way to contact for help - no chat or customer support number provided. Maybe we got a lemon, since it's got a lot of features at a good price!The real deal for 24" monitor - even without a BF sale. Have been looking at one for the kids in Sep and waiting on a reputable IPS FHD monitor - ergonomic with HDMI and Displayport inputs. Was not even listed on the HP site when we bought this for just over 100$. Our first monitor works good so far. It even has a speaker.

title: Worked beautifully----for about 30 days.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 14, 2020
text: This was a fine monitor--for about 30 days.  Then one day I turned it on and there are lines all over it and a black spot in the shape of a leaf.  If zero was a rating option, that's what I would give it. I don't have the box anymore, so I can't return it to Amazon.  I have spent about 6 hours in chats and on the phone with HP trying to get the POS replaced, but to no avail.  They keep making promises, but not following through.  After 3 separate contacts, I was told to call back if I didn't get a confirmation that a new monitor was on the way.  Not worth my time to spend another hour fighting with them.  Not only will I say that this item was a piece of crap, but HP's service has convinced me that I will never spend another dime on any HP product ever again; they obviously don't stand behind their product so why would I?If you decide to go ahead and get this POS monitor, keep the box, at least for the duration of the Amazon return because no way HP is going to help you out if it stops working.

text: I thought by buying something name brand it would at least work longer than 2 months. When I first received the monitor it gave me somewhat of an issue and saying it wasnt connecting to the HDMI. So I bought another one, played with it then finally it started working. However as time went on...it happened more often. I thought it was user error so I bought another cord (matter of fact 2) and none of them work. I called to get support and its been the worst experience ever. I am out of the 30 day warranty so I had to call HP. They ran me around and now I have to send it back for them to review but said they might not be able to fix it because I would have to pay $50 to start up a plan to have support. For a $150 monitor.... I think not! It should have lasted. I am sending it off today after a long process of getting shipping label, so we will see. I have been without an extra monitor for 2 months now. Crazy

title: Sub-par monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021
text: I work in IT and have experience with many low-budget monitors. This one is not worth the price.The main problem I have with this monitor is the image quality--it is one of the worst IPS displays I have seen.Even after tweaking settings, the quality of the image is still not what I would consider acceptable for the price.Another negative is the screen brightness, while it is suitable for general use, the display is surprisingly dim (especially for an IPS panel), and you may experience difficulty using it in an environment with direct sunlight.I am surprised by the number of positive reviews for this monitor, considering I have used many other FHD IPS monitors at this price point that make this one's image quality inexcusable in comparison.

title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!

text: I had this monitor for less than 2 months before a blue vertical line started showing on and off on the edge of the screen. The line doesn't show on the laptop screen connected to the monitor. Unfortunately the monitor was no longer returnable to Amazon and HP Support was no help! I have spend way too much time talking to them on the phone and chatting, I sent them pictures of the screen and their only answer was that this was a software related issue and that it was not covered under warranty. So I will have to pay to repair a monitor that I had for less than 2 months! That is utterly ridiculous! I checked several tech advise pages and they all stated if after you update the drivers, the line still shows, then it's an issue with the LCD, which would be hardware. I told the technicians at HP but they seem to be going off a script and won't truly answer your questions. Seriously, this is not worth all the hassle. I will never buy anything HP again.

I will not be purchasing any other HP products and I suggest that you don't either.Origional: This monitor arrived with a crack on the screen. There is also flecks of ripped plastic on the edges of the monitor which makes me think that this was a repackaged, used monitor. There is typically a plastic sheet that peals off the front of the monitor and this was was already pulled off. This is pretty disappointing to think that HP is selling used/damaged products.I have ordered a replacement. Until that arrives and works as intended I'm not happy with the purchase and expect more from HP.1 star until I receive the new product I paid for.

title: Get a refund, not a replacement!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 12, 2020
text: Within two hours of receiving this monitor, it turned off. And stayed off.  Then when I could get it to turn on again, the screen turned green.  Amazon was awesome and connected me to an HP rep.  She said they would send me a box and label to return the monitor and send a replacement within 10-12 business days.  That is NOT the case.  I contacted them on September 29 and it is now October 12 and still no return box or label.  I followed up and they told me I should receive it by October 14.Next, I was told that they will not ship the replacement until they receive the replacement monitor.  At this rate, I will not get the replacement until November.  When I asked if I could receive a refund instead, they basically said "too late."  With 40+ Zoom meetings between now and then, I will have to buy another monitor to use in the interim.If you get a dud like I did, opt for the refund ASAP.

text: I just purchased this HP monitor less than 2 months ago.  As I just replaced my Dell monitor I’ve had for over 16 years.  Out of nowhere the HP screen started glitching and now it doesn’t work and  I can’t do my work.  Really bad timing on a stressful day that demanded my top performance.  I called Amazon thinking they would help out as I am a Prime member.  Well, Amazon decided to sidestep this and forwarded me directly to HP customer service.  Not too happy Amazon is not stepping up here.  HP  customer service says they will need my monitor to repair it…….which will take weeks.  I will have to struggle with just using my laptop screen for a while.  I’ll update my review as this proceeds.

title: BEWARE! There's a reason this monitor is CHEAP!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 4, 2020
text: I was on the fence about buying this monitor but ended up doing so because of the hp brand name. Within two hours of use the screen has LED-backlighting burned into it. This is where the edges of the screen become burnt and discolored from poorly manufactured led lighting. Also, the picture is absurdly dark. I also suspect this to be the faulty LEDs. I went in to check the brightness and contrast setting only to find that both settings were already set near the max by factory default!  It's such a shame that amazon suggested this to me and that hp would put their name on something that's clearly defective. Don't be fooled by the nice trailers and good reviews like I was, just pay the extra $50 and get the monitor you actually want. It really is sad how far the quality standard has fallen. Well, I hope this helps others avoid this monitor like the plague.

title: Slow Monitor, poor refresh rate

text: The monitor is nice, but it only has a 60 hertz refresh rate but it advertise description says it has a 75. That makes a big difference.  Even bigger difference if you have a powerful video card.  Everything is so slow to display. It's like trying to pumping out a gallon of water thru a straw.  If have a basic machine then it is a GREAT monitor but if yo anything modern, you will see significant slow downs.  Like really slow.  Takes for ever for things to pull up.  There is a setting in the monitor that helps speed things up a bit, do that it helps, but still very slow.  That is why give it a one star.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Poorly made product?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
text: I purchased this monitor to replace an Acer 24" 1080p monitor that had lasted me over 7 years. I liked it because of the thin bezel and the price was great. The first monitor I received had discolored pixels in various places (see image) that would move depending on what was displayed on the screen. I tried several cables and even another computer, but the dead pixel look never let up. I installed the drivers for the monitor and updated my graphics drivers as well, with no success.After this I got a replacement monitor. The replacement monitor was worse because it showed up in packaging that had clearly been put back together after having been opened and used, and the screen had fingerprints and smudges on it. The second monitor also had the same pixel issues, except that it was also having an issue where the screen turns black every 30 seconds or so. Definitely disappointed and getting a refund.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Don't buy! This monitor went bad before it was 6 months old!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 5, 2021
text: I keep a screen saver on and turn off the monitor every night, however, before I even hit the 6 month ownership window on this monitor, it started to look like there were "burnt" pixels all over the screen. They come and go so I've realized they aren't truly burned into the screen but there is something actually wrong with the monitor itself that is distorting the way the pixels display. Of course, because I purchased this item in Oct. 2020, I'm past the window of returning the product or getting a refund even thought the monitor isn't even a year old which super duper sucks. I never write reviews, but do not anyone else to get screwed over buying this product. I have never used a monitor that petered out so quickly. I do not recommend buying this monitor!!!

title: Sent A Defective Monitor, Can’t Get Replacement
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2020
text: I recommend not purchasing this monitor, it did not work correctly from the start. Red and green pixels dancing all over the screen and constantly flickers on and off to the point it’s unusable with some of our laptops. I attempted to get a replacement through HP and was told I would have a box to return the old one in 3-4 days and then they would ship me a new one as soon as they received the defective monitor. After two weeks with no box I called them back and they said they were out of stock and it would be “another week” (we’ll see). The speakers have also stopped working right during this time, and only make a buzzing noise. So I’m stuck trying to work from home with this monitor that never worked right from the start. I’ll honestly probably never buy from HP again after this experience.

I will not buy another HP monitor. Period.I hope you have better luck than I did.

title: Picture flickers & is easily damaged

text: Bought 2 on 9/30/20. These monitors began flickering not long after - going black as I type. Moved on dual monitor stand to unplug the power plug as I was told. title: Broke within weeks of use. HP won't replace.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 18, 2021
text: The monitor worked fine for a few weeks until I tried to change its tilt. I gently grabbed it with both hands to tilt it, and the pressure from thumb actually produced a tiny crack in the screen. This crack though caused an area about 20% of the entire screen not to work. I really think there's a design flaw in the screen if gentle pressure can crack it. But even though I'd only owned it for weeks, HP customer service refused to take it back. Now it's useless. I will never buy an HP monitor again.

title: Distracting and Uneven Light Bleed
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 16, 2023
text: When I first unboxed this monitor I was so excited because of the good reviews. Assembly was pretty straightforward and I was wowed by the beautiful colors straight out of the box (Purchased for use with Photo Editing and Content Creation).I had minor issues with the contrast where the blacks wouldn't render well enough no matter how I tried to calibrate, but that wasn't as problematic as the reason this gets 2 stars...By the one month mark, I was playing a game that has a pure black border because of the aspect ratio. I noticed first an ugly yellow colored light bleed to the bottom left of the screen (as seen in attached photos).This deeply upset me because by the look of it, it may very well spread and become more problematic.If that wasn't enough, upon further inspection the right hand side of the monitor also has a light bleed that's less intense and white colored.Now I find it very distracting anytime I work with a dark picture or screen.This is really upsetting as I haven't even had this device two months and it received in perfect condition after shipping, which leads me to think this is a product defect.If this didn't happen this review would be a solid 4.

title: Alot Better Than I Expected

text: I was disappointed my "NU" brand monitor finally gave up the ghost and when I tried to find a replacement I was surprised their was very little to chose from for my 15" monitor.After spending hours searching online I saw this one and the reviews were mixed, some said it had speakers, some said no speakers, also I've never been to crazy about HP anything!I was hesitant because of the size difference from previous monitor (15") After being told I need to get out of the dinosaur age, I decide to give it a try.  So glad i did, it does not take up as much desk space as i thought it would. YES, it definitely has speakers and regardless what reviews say, they sound fine (I didn't even need to turn up in settings). Love the adjustable height and also that it will turn vertical if needed. Some reviews said it's too flimsy and the screen will break if trying to adjust tilt. I find this false as it's very well made.I am extremely satisfied and might even make another HP purchase in future (LOL) OH, i forgot, i guess that's no longer proper in this WOKE country we live in today. OH-Well, get over it!!Thanks, for a great product, Ray

title: Great for gamer on a budget, or as a backup.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2021
text: You can read a far better review than what I'll provide on displayninja.com, if you want a more technical write-up. I am reviewing this from a budget gaming / everyday use standpoint.I've been impressed with this monitor for what I paid for it, so far. I use this as my main monitor right now due to budget concerns. I bought two, so I can use dual monitors in the future, or as a backup. I'm reviewing this product as a budget gamer, not as someone who needs perfect color or accuracy.The monitor has very low input lag (this has nothing to do with advertised response time; read up on input lag if you don't know) which is great! I previously used the ASUS vh236h, which was a monitor that was used for years in professional fighting game events. This feels the same or better to me, though I do not have professional testing tools available. It rated ~10ms on displayninja's review.The monitor runs at 60hz or 75hz. You can set it up in your graphics card control panel. I experience one bug where when I set the scaling on my nVidia card and each time I choose 60hz, it defaults back to 75. This is only for the scaling options - the native resolution of 1920x1080 runs at either.  Also, the game Spelunky locks at 50 frames per second, regardless of the setting in my graphics control panel. This IS a known issue with Spelunky that I hadn't experienced on my old monitor. I can fix it by keeping VLC open in the background while the game is on. I wanted to mention this just to provide as much detail as possible about my experience.I use the monitor in portrait mode for pinball, and it's nice having the IPS screen so it is viewable from either angle, if I am slightly to the left or right (playing with two people for example). There are no issues tracking the ball, or any extreme ghosting using the default settings. It's even easier tracking the ball at 75hz, but this can screw up some physics in certain pinball games.I also play a lot of oldschool Doom  - online and off. It's a very fast paced game, and monitor performs well for what it is.As far as inputs, I use the Display Port input, and had to purchase a cable. Be aware that if you have an older computer / graphics card, and choose to use the VGA input, that can add some slight input lag converting the analog signal to digital. I also have my Nintendo Switch hooked up to the HDMI port. I like how the monitor switches inputs automatically depending on signal, so I can hit Windows Key + L (locking computer, which causes monitor to go to sleep after a minute), then turn on the switch and it will change inputs for me after a couple minutes.Some reviews have mentioned that the cables come loose. So far, mine are tight, but I can see the power cable loosening after many rotations into portrait mode. Will update review if I experience this.The speakers are actually not terrible. They aren't too tinny or grating on my ears like my past monitor. I use dedicated speakers for PC, but at the moment am happy with the onboard speakers for the Switch. There doesn't seem to be a quick shortcut button for volume, however. So I have to go into the menu to adjust. I just keep it at 10, and disable sound on my PC's Display Port connection so I don't have to worry about it.Speaking of menus, I find this one easy to use and functional. When you hit a button under the monitor, a shortcut menu will appear onscreen right above the buttons, so you know which one to hit without memorizing them. The menu is speedy and responsive. Keep in mind I've been using the ASUS vh236 for the past many years, so compared to that, this is amazing. I do not have much else to compare it too, however.A final note - one of my monitors had a small bit of plastic that wasn't molded correctly, and protrudes upwards from the bottom bezel. It does not reach the viewable area of the screen though, and is unnoticeable unless I'm looking for it.TLDR:-great for the budget gamer who doesn't mind 60/75 hz vs 120+-low input lag-rotates into portrait mode-lightweight, easy to rotate and tilt (tilts backward, and very slightly forward)-speakers are passable-thin upper and side bezels (good for multi-monitor setup)-easy to use menu-no volume shortcut, have to navigate menuIf you are on a budget, or just need another monitor, and can get this <=$120, it's an excellent deal.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Happy with my purchase, previous reviewers are confused.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021
text: I expected this to be 60hz and without built-in speakers due to some of the reviewers alleging false advertising. Now that I have my hands on it I can confidently say that they do not know what they are talking about. The display runs at 60hz by default, but can be set at 75hz in the display adapter settings (not Windows settings, the actual adapter settings). The speaker works fine, and sounds decent if you keep your expectations reasonable. To clarify I have it connected with DisplayPort, so I cannot vouch for HDMI but would expect the experience to be the same. I got this to use as a second screen in portrait orientation, and you can't beat it for the price. I needed something that was cheap to use for displaying digital textbooks, and for that purpose I really don't have any complaints.Pros: 75hz, bright, colors look good, included stand swivels (clockwise only), DisplayPort and HDMI inputs, built in speaker is a nice touch and doesn't sound too bad, arrived within three days w/o prime.Cons: The silver bezel looks a bit odd when in portrait (who cares), 5ms response time acceptable but not ideal for gaming.You could game on this, but might want to spend a little more on something with a lower response time. For day-to-day browsing, watching videos, a second monitor, and light gaming you can't go wrong with it.TL;DR: yes it's 75hz, yes it has a speaker, worth my $110, would buy again.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Good 75Hz monitor for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 6, 2020
text: The monitor is great for the price. I can use this monitor in either landscape or portrait mode. I have bought another HDMI switch and connected two inputs to this monitor. The monitor is set to 60 Hz by default so you will have to change it t 75 Hz. The speaker is not that great because it doesn't sound loud enough but I guess it's a nice feature to have anyway. The bezels are almost non-existent. I kind of wish that the bezel on the bottom was black because it would blend so well. Also, the monitor is easy to setup as it doesn't require you to have any special tools. One problem that I am facing is that the power cable is very loose on the back where it connects to the monitor and the monitor turns off if I move the power cable around. I am not sure if it's the male adapter on the end of the power cable or the female adapter of the monitor itself but I plan to contact the seller regarding this issue and return it if the cable issue isn't resolved. Other than that, the monitor is good for the price.

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)

text: This monitor is advertised with a refresh rate of 75herts, but when it arrived it was only 60hertz. If this is an issue for you, then beware of the false advertising. product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: HOW TO USE BUILT IN SPEAKERS AND HOW TO CHANGE AUDIO VOLUME
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 14, 2020
text: Some people said there are no built-in speakers. That's because you need to change the sound output settings on your computer:- Mac OS: Apple icon --> System Preferences --> Sound --> Output --> select HP 24mh- Windows: In the monitor menu, go to Management --> Audio --> check PC Analog Audio (based on another review)To change audio volume:1. Press any of the buttons next to the start button of the monitor twice.2. Use the arrows and icons to navigate the menu to Management --> Audio --> Volume3. You can also change volume settings on most video/audio playing apps.Remember that if you computer doesn't have an HDMI port, you will need to buy a separate adapter! For Mac laptops:1. Identify the model of your Mac2. Check what port it has by going to this website: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT2017363. Buy an adapter that transmit from your port to HDMI (not the other way around). Check the product description to see if the adapter is compatible with your laptop. For example, this adapter works well with my early 2015 Macbook Air:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07JDWR6W9/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=14. Plug the HDMI end of the adapter into the HDMI cable that comes with this monitor, and plug the other end of the adapter into your laptop.5. Then press the start button on the monitor to turn it on.6. If needed, change audio and volume settings as above.

title: What a bummer.....no DisplayPort or VGA cables.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020
text: Our company ordered 20 of HP 24mh monitors to replenish our stock. Our company uses computers that require the use of DisplayPort cables. To my surprise, the HP 24mh model only came with the AC plug, HDMI, and audio cable. The previous HP model we bought were P24 G4 which came with DisplayPort, VGA, and HDMI cables. So we figured this model HP 24mh would come with the same cords, however this is not the case. Both the P24 G4, and the 24 mh have the exact same specs. Me personally, I would go with the P24 G4 to have a variety of display options.  Unfortunately, we now have to purchase DisplayPort cables for our newly purchased HP 24mh model displays......real bummer...

title: Burnt one too many times by Hewlett Packard monitors.

text: Buyer beware! What ever happened to monitors lasting past 1year. And just try to hold this company accountable for poor quality equipment. product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)
title: Misleading Image
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2021
text: If you use basic math you will quickly find out that the dimensions listed on the image are false advertising at best. It is impossible to have an 18inch tall by 22 inch wide monitor and have your diagonal line measure out to 23 (Pythagorean theorem will reveal to you that the diagonal would need to be closer to 27 to be accurate). It is more like 12 inches tall by 22 ish inches wide. Don't be tricked.

title: At this price, they are amazing.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 7, 2022
text: I already have 2 gaming monitors: one for my cockpit and the other a 65" monitor that hangs from the ceiling right onto my bed. These have speakers, which is great because some of the more expensive ones don't come with their speakers. I don't want to put on my headphones every time I use the computer and I don't want to buy separate speakers.My work now sent me another 2 monitors that are bigger in size but don't have speakers. I am going to keep these in case I end up switching jobs again and having to send the work monitors back. They stupid-easy to assemble (if you can call it assemble, it's more like plug the base and you're done), and look great.These were just what I needed for the office.

title: Perfect! Great looking, easy to set up and excellent screening quality.

text: I needed this to work on a research project, and reading and searching on internet can be tiresome if you do it with a tiny screen, like my Chromebook's one. I enjoy my tiny Chromebook cause is so light and small that I just grab and go!! But when sitting at home for hours reading and reading...is not good working just with a tiny screen, I was getting frustrated and my eyes sore literally. This awesome HP monitor is a game changer, and my productivity will go up, no doubts of it. Great quality overall: stylish, greet screening, easy to set up and super light weighted. You would probably need to buy a Hub ( mine is an Anker USB C Hub (7-in-1) with several data ports if you have a Chromebook like me ( cause no HDMI port on my Google one ) also if you have an old laptop with no HDMI port. I keep heating my head now, thinking of why I didn't purchase this earlier!!NOTE: Pictures maybe no that great cause I was excited of posting my review, so still have to decide where to set it up. title: Great picture, low volume
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 25, 2021
text: This is a wonderful monitor and the second one that I have purchased (or third depending on how you look at it). The first was for my wife It came with a broken display so I had it replaced with no problem. The replacement worked just fine. Then I was so happy with it that I got another for myself. The picture is sharp and bright with several adjustments and presets. I am running mine at 75Hz and 1920x1080. It has no lag. Also no lag at 60Hz. My complaint is that there is very low volume out of the built in speakers. I wanted a monitor to replace a visio 24' tv that I was using as a monitor (it had a lag and ran at 60Hz) so I also wanted a monitor with speakers. Compared to the visio the sound is quite low. So for gaming (I am not a gamer so I am guessing now) it has great picture and no lag which is important but will need an additional set of speakers to hear the blood-curdling screams of dead solders in "call of duty" or "halo" or whatever. ;-)

product_name: HP 24mh FHD Monitor - Computer Monitor with 23.8-Inch IPS Display (1080p) - Built-In Speakers and VESA Mounting - Height/Tilt Adjustment for Ergonomic Viewing - HDMI and DisplayPort - (1D0J9AA#ABA)

title: A decent budget monitor
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2021
text: I haven't used a desktop monitor in some years and it will take me some time to adjust to the more basic features of this one. For the price, it does the job quite well, but cannot compare with the clarity, etc. that one finds on laptop monitors. The colors seems reasonably accurate and the brightness (250 nits) is adequate but usually has to be kept at the maximum level. This is certainly not a gaming monitor.If you buy this monitor to use it with a desktop PC for office work, it will do the job but you could probably do better if you spend a bit more. Letters, for example, are not all that crisp on the screen and while easily readable, you might find them a bit thin/dull and not having enough brightness.The features of the monitor are basic. If you wish to place a webcam on top of it, you would need one with a less bulky clamp. I used the following: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086GQSKK3/ and it fit perfectly, the clamp staying just above the screen area.Being able to adjust easily the monitor height is a plus and installation was easy. Overall - this is a decent budget monitor that doesn't spark or dazzle but does the job fine.

text: I purchased this monitor to upgrade from a 19" Dell.  I have found it to be a very good viewing size. Speakers provide good sound, and it is one of a few with a DisplayPort connection.  This was very much needed as my docking station needs DisplayPorts for connectivity.  Buyer should be aware: A HDMI cable is provided. However, a DisplayPort, or VGA cable or audio connectors aren't. The base does not swivel.  It does have height and tilt adjustment, rotation from landscape to portrait view.  Speaker volume, display, brightness, and other options are done via the onscreen management settings.  I would recommend to download the display driver from HP for this unit, to ensure it is properly recognized on your laptop or PC. Overall, I found it to be a good price/performance value.

title: quality product, excellent versatile stand, no power brick
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 19, 2021
text: I'm probably approaching the purchase of a monitor from a different perspective from many. I wanted a reasonably large monitor but not so large that I couldn't remove it from the table for weekends. Nevertheless, i wanted the ability to rotate the screen to fit a letter on it comfortably. i had also wanted lightweight.The HP  has a brilliant stand, & is v sturdy.  it allows sliding the monitor up & down, at an angle, & yes it does allow full rotation. I read in questions varying answers. The trick to rotation is that one has to slide the monitor as far up from the base as possible, then angle it upwards, at which point it will then  will clear the bottom to allow rotation; otherwise it will not.i wanted a screen that prevents eye fatigue. ASUS advertises this in its headline description. HP has the ability  in its menu to select low blue light, which is the main way to reduce eye fatigue.  The menu system is v easy to use & access.  It also has HP enhance + which I highly recommend in other situations.  The versatility of positioning of the monitor makes for much less stress on eyes too.The screen with stand is not the  lightest at 10 pounds for a 24 inch but  not terrible.  This includes the  magnificent stand which  is v easy to detach unlike many others. Its a simple push to disengage, & pull at the back. This allows for easy storage, in my case over weekends. Keep the packing material to protect the screen. Id say that added at least a few pounds, & was completely worth it.  The monitor also  incorporates the brick many monitors leave with the cable. I don't like all those power cables with bricks, so i welcome the choice. again this adds a pound but avoids clumsiness and unsightly wiring.resolution is reasonable on par with most other basic monitors. the refresh rate apparently can run up to 75hz but i haven't tested this with my Chromebook. the usb-c displayport works perfectly .For the price this is excellent value. a premium build monitor for a basic price.

title: Top Notch Monitor with Great Audio...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2022
text: Monitor is quite easy to setup at home. Screen clarity is spectacular. A lot of reviewers have complained about the overall sound quality, but it's actually very good. So, please do not assume that you are purchasing a product with poor audio. The audio is solid. That said, you will have to manually adjust the audio as some reviewers have stated. The audio is the one feature that will definitely not be perfect right out of the box. Adjust via the monitor by going into the settings - select Management - Audio - Volume. Increase the volume to 100. Then, if you have an HP laptop -- System -- Sounds -- All Sound Devices -- Select HP 24 mh. Adjust the monitor volume as needed. If your laptop is a different brand be sure to adjust the audio for the actual monitor. I will likely purchase a second monitor in the future. This one so far has actually exceeded my expectations. This particular monitor is ideal for anything from working on Excel spreadsheets to watching a movie on Amazon Prime (with or without headphones).

title: Can it get any better than this?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 28, 2022
text: I was looking at refurbished 27 inch monitors, but was not real happy with what I was finding and at the lack of monitors with Display Port connection. So I changed my search solely for monitors with Display Port and I ran into this wonderful monitor. I don't understand how it got so many bad reviews! The picture is sharp and clear and the colors are excellent. The controls are easy to use and allow you to adjust the monitor to whatever it takes to meet your needs. Over the years I've owned many monitors with built in speakers and usually they sound like crap, tinny with no low end, but this one really shines. Sound quality is excellent and it is very loud, if you want it to be. I think HP is using television technology for the sound. Last of all, the price was a bargain. A brand new 24 inch monitor at this price, with this quality is a steal!
